perturbation.original_text: 1.1 The term "AETRU System" means an integrated all-electric vehicle refrigeration system comprising of Product as the refrigeration mechanism  and the AuraGen as the power-supply.
perturbation.changed_text: 1.1 The term "AETRU System" means an integrated vehicle refrigeration system.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the specificity that the AETRU System includes 'Product as the refrigeration mechanism and the AuraGen as the power-supply,' subsequent references to AuraGen within the context of AETRU System sales become ambiguous. This omission creates uncertainty about which specific components are included or required in the AETRU system, contradicting other sections detailing responsibilities related to the AuraGen.

perturbation.changed_text: 3.7 End-User Warranty. At all times during the Term of this Agreement, Zanotti shall warrant the Products to purchasers of AETRU Systems in  accordance with a warranty policy determined solely by Zanotti. Aura is not responsible for warranty distribution.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the reference to Exhibit C and stating the warranty is determined solely by Zanotti introduces ambiguity. Previously, a minimum 36-month warranty was stipulated. Now, this is undefined, creating uncertainty and potential conflict with other sections assuming a specific warranty. This is further compounded by stating that Aura is not responsible for warranty distribution, which could conflict with the previous statement that a 'copy of the End User Warranty shall be included as part of the packaging'.

8.17 Indemnity. Zanotti agrees to indemnify, defend and hold Aura, including its employees, agents and affiliates, harmless from and against any  and all payments, damages, demands, claims, losses, expenses, costs, obligations and liabilities (including reasonable attorney's fees and costs),  which arise out of, result from or are related to: (i) any breach by Zanotti of any provision contained in this Agreement, including without limitation  any obligation, representation, warranty or covenant herein; (ii) any occupational injury or illness sustained by any employee or agent of Zanotti  to the extent claims are made against, or held to be payable by

Aura; (iii) any applicable sales or other taxes due from or on behalf of Zanotti regardless of whether such taxes must be collected by Aura on

behalf of the taxing authority and regardless of whether Zanotti shall challenge the assessment or amount of such taxes (iv) any negligent or willful

act or omission or violation of any contractual arrangement of Zanotti or any of Zanotti's affiliates, officers, directors, agents or employees of

each, in connection with its or their performance relating to this Agreement; or (v) Zanotti's agreements, if any, with any other third parties.

Aura agrees to indemnify, defend and hold Zanotti, including its employees, agents and affiliates, harmless from and against any and all

payments, damages, demands, claims, losses, expenses, costs, obligations and liabilities (including reasonable attorney's fees and costs), which

arise out of, result from or are related to the breach by Aura of any representation, warranty or covenant contained in this Agreement.

Either party seeking indemnification under this Agreement (the "Indemnified Party") shall give notice to the party required to provide

indemnification hereunder (the "Indemnifying Party") promptly after the Indemnified Party has actual knowledge of any claim as to which

indemnity may be sought hereunder, and the Indemnified Party shall permit the Indemnifying Party (at the expense of the Indemnifying Party) to

assume the defense of any claim or litigation resulting thereform; provided that: (i) counsel for the Indemnifying Party who shall conduct the

defense of such claim or litigation shall be reasonably satisfactory to the Indemnified Party; (ii) the Indemnified Party may participate in such

defense, but only at the Indemnified Party's own cost and expense; and (iii) the omission by the Indemnified Party to give notice as provided

herein shall not relieve the Indemnifying Party of its indemnification obligations hereunder except to the extent that such omissions results in a

failure of actual notice to the Indemnifying Party and the Indemnifying Party is damaged as a result of such failure to give notice. The

Indemnifying Party shall not, except with the consent of the Indemnified Party, consent to entry of any judgment or administration order or enter

into any settlement that (i) could affect the intellectual property rights or other business interests of the Indemnified Party or (ii) does not include

as an unconditional term thereof the giving by the claimant or plaintiff to the Indemnified Party of a release form all liability with respect to such

claim or litigation.

In the event that the Indemnified Party shall reasonably and in good faith determine that the conduct of the defense of any claim subject

to indemnification hereunder or any proposed settlement of any such claim by these Indemnifying Party might be expected to affect adversely the

Indemnified Party's intellectual property rights or ability to conduct future business, the Indemnified Party shall have the right at all times to take

over and assume control over the defense, settlement, negotiations or lawsuit relating to any such claim at the sole cost and expense of the

Indemnifying Party.

In the event that the Indemnifying Party does not accept the defense of any matter as provided herein, the Indemnified Party shall have

the full right to defend against any such claim or demand, and shall be entitled to settle or agree to pay in full such claim or demand, in its sole

discretion.

The provisions of this Section 8.17 shall survive the expiration or sooner termination of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: 8.17 Indemnity. Zanotti agrees to indemnify Aura for direct damages resulting from Zanotti's gross negligence. Aura agrees to indemnify Zanotti for direct damages resulting from Aura's gross negligence. The indemnifying party is only responsible if it receives notice of the claim within 30 days of its occurrence.
perturbation.explanation: By significantly shortening and simplifying the indemnity clause, several contradictions and ambiguities are introduced. The original clause provided comprehensive coverage, including attorney's fees and various liabilities. The modified clause only covers direct damages from gross negligence, making it unclear what happens with other types of claims previously covered, like breach of contract or intellectual property infringement. Additionally, a very tight 30-day notice period is established, creating conflict with the survival clause stating that provisions of 8.17 will survive the expiration or sooner termination of this Agreement. This implies that the indemnification obligation exists beyond the agreement term but is limited by the 30-day period creating a contradiction.
